docs.lead_paragraph: The interesting feature of yesterday's meeting of the Board of Estimate and Apportionment, which continued its work in arranging the final financial budget for 1896, was the allotment to the Street Cleaning Department. Commissioner Waring and several of his assistants were present. After the discussion, Col. Waring was allowed $3,020,700 for his department, as against $2,396,000 originally allowed for this year.

headline.main: TO KEEP STREETS CLEAN; Col. Waring Allowed Over $3,000,000 for His Department. DISCUSSION OVER "FINAL DISPOSITION" Bill Favored for Grading Salaries -- Controller Fitch and a Liberal Allowance -- Criticism for Bridge Terminal.
